text: Birra Menabrea was born in Biella in 1846 and, to date, is the oldest brewery that
still produces in the same factory where it produced the first bottle over 175 years ago.
We needed to become a more modern company,
so we have chosen AWS to support us in this process of digitalization and
digital transformation of Birra Menabrea. AWS has definitely helped us to become a
company that is able to respond in a more agile and faster way to the new challenges
and needs of the market, which are becoming more and more complex.
Our main challenge was to continue to ensure the growth of our business and
its margins by offering the best product quality and optimal customer service.
Corley is what is called a "Cloud Boutique": a
small company made up of great technical skills and expertise that are
made available to customers for their cloud transformation journey.
The first challenge we faced with Birra Menabrea
was connecting the production plants with the cloud,
which, in practice, means connecting the services AWS offers with the
components of the production line, which, by nature, are typically offline.
To address this challenge, the first goal we set for ourselves was to migrate to the cloud,
which, with the support of AWS, allowed us to open up new paths.
In particular, I would like to mention the projects we worked on with Corley, one of
the partners we chose through AWS. The first is the MES project, Manufacturing Execution System,
that allowed us to create a system for monitoring and analyzing the efficiency of
production lines. The second on this list is the energy project, through which we created a
system for monitoring and analyzing the plants energy consumption. The third is the admin
project, which consisted in the creation of an automatic administrative data management system
in order, as the name suggests, to simplify administrative activities.
Thanks to AWS, we have had the opportunity to access skills
and technologies that we would have otherwise struggled with.
One of our biggest accomplishments was bringing the cloud into a
company steeped in tradition. We were able to connect in real time something
that, by nature, was difficult to bring into the cloud ecosystem
every component of the production line, piece by piece - with AWS.
